Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a pleasant and peaceful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: elisabethabib
Reviews.Content: Borromini hotel is a very good hotel in a pleasant and peaceful neighborhood of Rome. The staff is very polite and helpful. The rooms are wide and clean, as well as the bathroom. We had satellite TV with the possibility of watching the shows in original language (English) which was really a plus! The bed/pillow/mattress were really comfortable. The breakfast was not top-notch but enough to make you full and ready for the day! The hotel is 30min in bus from Termini station and 2 buses are needed. It is more difficult to reach the city center (i.e: Piazza Venezia) but for tourist with time ahead this is not a problem. Of course, for the tourist in a hurry I would not recommend this hotel. The neighborhood is pleasant and peaceful, full of embassies and consulates so quite secure. Also, a lot of good restaurants can be found all around.

Reviews.Title: “Average all round, Uninterested Staff”
Reviews.Author: Connel90
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we could clearly see the receptionist sitting in the back. He looked up acknowledged our being there but carried on with his computer leaving the two of us standing there for what seemed like 10 minutes. When he finished his business he walked round and checked us in without so much as a smile. First impressions are everything and unfortunately it wasn't the best. This staff behaviour carried on throughout the stay When we got into the room we were pleasantly surprised as it was very spacious, clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only downside to the room was the size of the bath which was very small indeed. Breakfast in the morning was a bit of a let down, the cereals were left out from the night before making them stale and the pastries and bread were not covered (thus all were stale.) This was the breakfast in its entirety (bread rolls, cereal, pastries and tinned fruit.) The hotel is a little out of the way but due to public transport does not pose a problem and leads to a good nights sleep and access to well priced and good quality restaurants (Taverna Rossini). When we return to Rome we will be tempted to stay in the same area but would certainly choose a different hotel, one that is more friendly to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: AussieRandR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a residential area, so is quiet but the closest restaurants is 10 minutes walk. The restaurant was recommended by the Front Desk Manager and the food was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. BUT, the problems on their own were only minor when added together were frustrating. We could only get 2 extra pillows. The bedside lights were broken. A strong smell of sewage at the front door. The shower was a joke, the cubicle too small and there was no hot water and the cold was just a dribble. The TV didn't work in accordance with the instructions in the room, after 2 attempts by staff I eventually worked it out myself, vital step missing in instructions. The door to the balcony could not be locked, the catch was broken; the front desk said "Don't worry this is an honest neighborhood, we have never had any problems and your on the fifth floor anyway." If you don't expect too much you won't be disappointed, you can do better closer to the centre for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Mayberries
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights as part of a tour package of Europe. Hotel is located in a residential area, which we thought was good. Hotel needs a little re-vamping or updating. Rooms were good, bed comfortable enough, bathroom clean as was the room. Staff were friendly service was good. Breakfast was average. Bar staff were great as our christmas day was spent here at night. Considering this was a major holiday in Italy, I would say that the services provided by the hotel were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Staff, slightly out of the way (Big deal)”
Reviews.Author: Damien T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel after booking a last minute trip to Rome. Following the booking I then read up on trip advisor and have to say some of the reviews are simply preposterous. Yes the hotel is slightly out of the way but no more than 10 Euro to travel to anywhere of interest within the city day or night, and which meant for a good sleep after all the hectic sightseeing, bars and restaurants Rome has to offer. The front office staff were brilliant, we had a few problems initially with working the shower and TV which were resolved immediately by Concierge. On our last day we were flying out early evening and asked the front desk if there was anywhere in central Rome to leave our bags if we paid and he replied "I can do 1 better" and organised us to leave our bags at their 5* sister hotel The Xenda which was 2 minutes’ walk from Rome Termini so perfect. All in all, this hotel was perfect and anyone claiming otherwise is either ridiculous or has too much time on their hands to moan....

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: The desk clerks upon arrival were all smiles and very warm to the guests (much more so than others we frequented during our tour), and they maintained that demeanor each time we approached them with a question and also when we observed them helping others. In fact, one modest gentleman in particular requested that our review be based on the hospitality of the hotel instead of himself or any other desk clerks. We had some humorous conversations about the language barrier (my wife and I are American) and compared our different cultures. The hotel overall was very clean and offered great food for the breakfast buffet. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: anjulil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of the way a bit - which leads to a good nights sleep - but really well connected to town by bus routes (as is all of Rome!) 5 mins away is the bus that takes you to the Trevi fountain, even nearer is the bus that takes you to the Colusseum and the Vatican. Luce (the concierge) is really friendly - ask him for a restaurant recommendation - we had the BEST meal of the holiday at the restaurant he suggested. The hotel is clean and modern - never ate there as there are so many lovely restaurants in walking distance or in town. The room was basic for a 3.5-4 star hotel but clean - the bathroom was lovely - definitely need a good shower at the end of a day roaming around Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Loud”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls, glad i don't speak italian or french or dutch! Very small shower ! Also the elevator does not hold you and the luggage cart. The hotel is in a residential area and very far away from the main attractions and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Same RAW SEWERAGE Odor in June”
Reviews.Author: mellow131
Reviews.Content: Not 4 stars! We stayed here at the end of June, 2011 and totally agree with TNT99 on all points. Biggest problem was the strong stench of raw sewage in the lobby and breakfast area. Response from the front desk was "that's not the hotel's fault!" Also found walls so thin that everything said and done in the next bathroom could be heard. TV volume and AC was pre-set and unchangeable with the room controls. Stains on furniture, stained flooring, rotting moldings, cracked marble, trouser press in two rooms didn't work/no iron. Photos and info. put out by the hotel are misleading - rooms are small and dark; it is not close to bike rental, Rome Center or dependable public transportation. The bus from Rome Center to the stop near the hotel stops running at 9 pm. Very intimidating area - dark, lonely and a far walk from the bus if you stay downtown after 9 pm. It is close to Borghese Park, the Zoo and a few nice cafes.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: Ari56
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, air conditioned, good breakfast included. Price was pretty good for in the city during peak season. Very gracious people at the desk who took care of our needs (taxis, baggage, restaurants, etc.). The restaurant recommendation was excellent. Bed was comfortable and the shades were very good to keep light out for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable & Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandJo
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Rome before our trip for my 40th birthday and only knew a small amount of Italian (hello, your welcolme, thank you, good bye). We were surprised how many people in resturants,shops and museums can speak enough English to make themselves understood and understand us. The hotel is situated in a peaceful leafy suburb near the Villa Borghese (Rome's main park) and although out of the city of Rome, it still felt like you were not too far away from it as it was easy to get their by the trams and buses. First buy a travel pass (BTI - biglietto turistico integrato) from a local tabaconist (tabacchi) on your way to Viale Liegi (Ungheria) the nearest stop for number 19 tram and the number 3 bus into Rome (if you have the metro and tram map these routes are marked). The hotel's Continental buffet breakfast (from 7am to 10am) was delicious (Croissants, pastries,yoghurt,cereals,cakes,cheese,cold meats,various fruit juices, tea and coffee) and the staff were helpful. The staff didn't impose themselves on you which was good. We were pleasantly surprised to get patio sliding doors leading out to a small balcony with chairs and a table and we sometimes sat out at night listening to the owls hooting in the nearby trees, it was so peaceful. All the facilities in our room worked fine. The only drawback was the air con wasn't in operation as they switched it on from June which was a shame as it was warm in our room during April. Locally there was a several resturants, various shops,supermarket. We'd stay there again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet and good value”
Reviews.Author: wherescharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in May 2011. 15 euros taxi fare from Termini station. Located on a quiet side street so no 'scooter' noise. Reception staff were efficient with the duty manager being particularly helpful with maps and bus advice. Bus stop 100m away with regular service to the city centre. Local cafe has great fresh coffee, only 80 cents, and sells bus tickets. The room was spacious and clean with Satellite TV and Free internet access. Only 'issue' was that we were informed that Roman Law dictates that the rooms air conditioning could not be switched on until July. It was a sticky 14 degrees at night but with the window wide open we coped and just got used to it. Overall a nice, clean, quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pass this one up”
Reviews.Author: mountainview03
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a 4 star rating according to other reviewers. It does look good and the rooms are well decorated. They have one of those tubs we've seen in other parts of Italy that has a half glass enclosure instead of one that extends the full length of the tub. This arrangement allows you saturate the floor at the same time you freeze to death while taking a shower. For us it was the worst hotel we've stayed in all of Italy. The staff is rather "snooty". They appear to be too busy playing with their computers to stop for a moment to answer questions of clients. Many sins can be forgiven when the staff is friendly or at least helpful. The restaurant could not get themselves together early enough to provide breakfast. Instead, they put together a BAG of breakfast that was laughable. It contained a soft apple, a wax carton container of APRICOT JUICE, a Little Debbie style cookie, yuk!! No one in our group ate it. There was a baby in the room beside us that cried intermittently through the night. They charged 15 euros PER DAY for internet access!! It takes more than looks to make a hotel nice. This one doesn't pass the test.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty Dusty Dusty”
Reviews.Author: lshopsonline
Reviews.Content: I got Boscolo Borromini Hotel via priceline bid. For the price I paid, I could've booked into a B&B. Boscolo Borromini Hotel CANNOT be considered a 4-star hotel. There is nothing 4-star about it. We arrived early (noonish). It wasn't a busy time of day for them. There were 2 people around the front desk area but I waited over 20 minutes to be checked-in. They were busy talking on the phone. The service was just so-so. When we entered the room, it was dark. We opened the curtains and there were dusts flying everywhere. Other than that, the room was fine. The size is average for a European hotel. It's definitely a party hotel; there were tons of people in the Lobby / bar in the evening. So if you want to party, it's a great place to be; if you are not, the noise might not be welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not worth 4* title”
Reviews.Author: bogartLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was basic - no tea or coffee making services in room. Breafast staff were excellent chatted with us and were helpful. Reception staff were not forthcoming in offering information as to how to get around. Hotel quite a far way away from tourist area and therefore we returned to hotel around 7 in the evenings and did not go out again. There is n o entertainment at hotel, no restaurant facilities. Would class this hotel as 2*/3*.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Davis_10
Reviews.Content: What a great older hotel in a very upscale area of Rome. A bit off the beaten path if you want to go into the City Center however taxi ride is only 10-15 Euros each way, not a problem if you split it with four people. The rooms have all been redone and are absolutely beautiful. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “If you like your room 80 degrees you'll love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JasonHouston
Reviews.Content: First things first, the photos of this hotel are nowhere close to reality. The front desk reminded me of a dark cold war hotel with two black and white flickering security camera televisions on the floor and a bank of boxes on the wall there room keys used to be stored. The back office was visible from the front reception area and I wish I could erase those memories from my head. When you get to the 4th or 5th floors, look up in the hallways and you will see that many of the ceiling tiles are nowhere to be found leaving holes to look up into the wiring and plumbing of the hotel. Oh, and the blue shag carpet with blue acrylic poles on the stairwells is classy - wish I had a photo. When we checked in we were given a room with two twin beds and not the room with a king bed as requested weeks in advance of arriving. Come to think of it, all of my email communications pre-trip went unanswered. The staff was very accommodating in changing our room to a room with a king bed. One thing that did catch my eye was the fact that each electronic room key cards have a sticker on it with your room number and are reused for the same room guest after guest. So much for the point that the card system was designed so if you should lose the card no one will know which room you are in. So if you ever get room 404 – I washed my hands before using the card… can’t say that about anyone else using that card. We got into the room and were initially hit by a heat wave. One of those heat waves that takes the moisture right out of your eyes. The type where you can feel your face shrinking. I immediately found the thermostat, selected AC, and turned it to 5 C (was preset to 22 C). Nothing happened. No noise of a fan kicking on. It was at this stage that my fiancée called me into the bathroom to inspect a pubic hair stuck on the backside of the door. Awesome. I opened the window and we decided to go into town to get some dinner as it had been a long day traveling from the US. Location – this place is far away from anything you might want to see if you are a tourist. I highly recommend staying somewhere else if location means anything to you. There are two tram (19 and 3) lines that can take you to a Metro stop (Policlinico – Blue line) and one bus (53) that can take you to either a Metro stop (Barberini – Red line) or close to the Spanish Steps. Note that bus line #53 does not run on public holidays or on Sundays – found that out the hard way. We took the bus to the Spanish Steps the first night and it took at least 30 minutes to get there. There is a great story about a bus driver shattering the glass partition with his elbow while arguing with a customer, but that is not related to the hotel. So we get back to the hotel (it is December and cold outside) and get to our room with the window open… and it is still pretty warm. I figure it only feels warm because we came in from the cold. Wrong. We spent the night with basically no sheets covering us with the window open sweating on the rock hard bed. I cannot underplay how much I was sweating all night long. I went to the front desk the next morning and made comments regarding how hot the room was and the front desk said they would send someone up to look into the problem. When we returned that evening the room was still blazing hot so I went back down to the front desk where I was told to turn off the heat…. Ok. I withheld comments and calmly expressed that the heat was off and set to 5C but the room felt closer to 30C (Which is 86F and a bit of an exaggeration, but I was trying to make a point). The front desk guy said, “That is impossible”. I still laugh at that exchange. So the guy came up to the room and looked at the thermostat and concluded it was off. And then he was off, leaving pretty quickly before I asked him how to raise the shutters to get more air in the room. He looked at me like I was an idiot and pressed a small button no larger than a square inch just to the right of the electrical outlet and the shutter started to open. Out went the helper. Nothing like having your window wide open all night long just to try and get the room bearable – “hello person across the alley, how are you tonight?” Even with the window open and it being close to 5C outside, the sheet was more than enough… almost too much some nights as it was very hot in the room. When I asked the front desk if I could turn the AC on to cool them room I was told no, the AC does not work. Down at the bar one night I overheard another table talking about how hot his room was. I hope he found the switch to open the shutters. One more thing - there are a lot of tour groups that pass through here. The reception area can get very busy and the line for one of the two elevators can get very very long. Some positives – the bar was not overpriced compared to the rest of Rome. A bottle of decent red wine was only 20 Euros. The front desk did recommend a nice pizzeria for dinner and they also helped arrange a driver to take us to the airport. The driver turned out to be very nice and took us on a tour of the Roman highlights on the way to the airport (it was a fixed rate ride, so no extra distance fees).

Reviews.Title: “Too far from everything”
Reviews.Author: Aimen
Reviews.Content: It was a 4 star hotel so had the frills but its too far from everything. No bus from the center fo rome goes there directly so have to change two buses far from the Hop on Hop off route as well. And its in the middle of no where so no good places to eat. Plus in 120 dollars a night they didnt even include the breakfast which was 12 euros per person. Though was clean and had frills. I would not stay here again for the reason that its too inconveniently located and we wasted an hour every day just trying to get back to it. Also when we tried to check in at 9 30 AM two hours before the time. We were told flat out that the room is not ready and the person at the desk didnt even bother checking. I would have appreciated the courtesy of him atleast pretending that he checked.

Reviews.Title: “Some what off the beatten path but woth considering”
Reviews.Author: BillyMeridianMS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Borromini is located in what is described as upper middle class section of Rome, just off the Piazza Hungaria. It caters to tourist groups. Provides a good continetal breakfast but otherwise plan to eat out. I booked it as a 4 star hotel and was very satisfied with the room and housekeeping. Located just half block from a bus stop you can be in the heart of tourist attraction Rome in 10--20 minutes. It is also just 3 blocks from a major tram line. A single person traveling alone may want a bit more excitement and company of other travelers. Most guests were part of tour groups. There are at least two wonderful resturants within walking distance, Tavern Rossini and second escapes me, but it atually better than Rossini. Both were recommended by desk clerks all of whom were multilingual. If you want quiet comfortable in a residential neighborhood I recommend Borrromi. Public trans or taxi's required to reach tourist Rome. Billy C. Beal

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: athenor84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2009 for a long weekend. I booked this property only because it offered the best price I gould get from a first category hotel. Location is not that good (residential area), unless you're going to rent a scooter (and be killed by a crazy-driving-local) or a car (and be fined every 100 metres) you must hire a cab to get into the centre. Staff was nothing special, breakfast was poor (even for a 3 star hotel), rooms were average in size but probabily needing a refusbishment (ie they look old). Bathrooms were well mantained with plenty of fluffy bathrobes. Nothing to say about daily cleanliness, very accurate. I'd suggest this property only if you can get a good price and or you're staying in Rome for a business trip (and being distant from the city center is not that important to you). PS: Ask for room on the last floor (the fifth I think) with balcony.

Reviews.Title: “somewhere inbetween”
Reviews.Author: sososo_8
Reviews.Content: I was quite confused by the diverse reviews of the boscolo borromini hotel prior our journey. I learned that the truth lies somewhere inbetween. Some of the staff were very helpful, some not. Two of the rooms were nice, the third reminded more of a cellar. The breakfast was nothing special, not terrible but not great. Coffee terrible. The hotel lies in a calm and quiet neighbourhood, but is very off from the city center. Too far to walk, and not so easy to go by bus either. The hotels' own pictures shows furniture that does not even exist in the hotel. The restaurant and bar is not at all as in the pictures. And the patio was not open and did not look anything like the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of scam”
Reviews.Author: Mr_REM
Reviews.Content: We traveled with a group for two weeks in Italy. The Borromini in Rome was our last stop. Tthe rooms were "tacky"...the bedspreads were the kind you want to take off right away..and the rooms dark. But we were not in Italy for the rooms, so this didn't bother us. The attitude of the staff however, really was upsetting. They were totally indifferent...they don't greet you...they waited until YOU look for them...or say in a loud voice..."hello?"....they had zero interest in pleasing the customer...while we were there a scam was perpetrated on us... We arranged a transfer company to take us to the airport at 7:00 a.m. We waited in the lobby directly next to the front desk. When they arrived two men showed up in sport coats and very loudly announced that our taxi was there...a third man dressed in black, came in following the first two, he grabbed our two carry ons and went out the door (we thought he was putting them into the cab) The other two men grabbed the bigger suitcases and we followed them out...I was shocked when I looked into the cab and our carry ons were not there nor was the man dressed in black (my heart medicine, our brand-new digital camera, video camera, cell phone...my jewelry etc everything you keep close when you travel were all in those bags). I was panicked and ran back into the hotel to tell the staff. The staff were nonchalant looking...they said nothing even though they personally witnessed the whole thing. I felt totally alone and had no help .....I feel that while I am a guest in a hotel...it is their responsibility to look out for us....especially when we are being victimized on their premises...and right in front of them....but don't ask them anything....they could care less ...you are just one more tour person (we were with Trafalgar)...they have them coming and going all the time. It really upset us and I think people should be aware of how they run their hotel. The transfer guys could care less....they just got in the cab...didn't speak to us (only talked in Italian)..and when we got to the airport...he bumped the price that we were quoted from 40 to 50 euroes....and in a very intimidating way demanded the 50 euroes...and then had to gall to say (in perfect English)..have a nice day. This was our dream vacation. We planned and saved for this trip. Unfortunately, this hotel and incident on the last day put a cloud over the enitre vacation.

Reviews.Title: “borromini would be last of my choices while in rome”
Reviews.Author: KIKONEWJERSEY
Reviews.Content: i usually travel numerous times a year with friends and my responsabilty is to choose the hotels;but i made a big mistake but choosing this one .let me start by telling you that italians are not friendly at all,hotel staff was rude,never seen them smiling. the hotel is so out the way,it takes a while to get to city center and to the main attractions in rome.i booked this hotel through priceline but don't make the same mistake,you better off booking a hotel in city center close to the attactions. stay in rome for two days is more than enough time.there is a lot to see in other parts of italy,don't waste too much time in rome. italians they were not friendly with tourists and they have terrible attitude. the room at the hotel was small,it smell like cigarrette and mold ,very simple and is like a cheap motel room,definetely this hotel is no...way...a four star hotel as priceline describedit,seems more like a two stars. also there are not too many restaurants choices nearby.definitely i would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No way a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CPH_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel through Priceline as a 4 star, and no way this should be labeled as such! Old and worn out interior, uncomfortable beds, rude (well they are Italian) personnel and out-of-the-city location. Not recommended. Not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Borromini!”
Reviews.Author: VTLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: We thought the Borromini was great. My fiance and I traveled to Rome from Vermont for Christmas week. Admittedly, I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews; however, we found the Borromini to be in a fine location (we're walkers and hikers), very close to the Villa Borghese, which makes for a lovely walk to/from sites, with very nice staff and accomodations. They had a great American style buffet breakfast with eggs cooked to order, meats, cereals, yogurts, fruits, juices, coffee, etc. The breakfast was $12 Euros, but hey, in Rome, for all-you-can-eat, that's a bargain. A two minute walk to a bus or tram stop will take you anywhere in the city you want to go. At the nearest piazza (where the bus/tram stops are located) there was a lovely little cafe that had very reasonable food, so we ate dinner there frequently on our way back to the room after a day out. The room itself was neat, clean, and the location of the hotel itself was residential - quiet and nice. They even gave us a surprise bottle of champagne for my fiance's birthday - and it was really good too! Its true that the Borromini is somwhat removed from the "center" of Rome, but then again, there is so much to see all over Rome, the city didn't seem too large/overwhelming, all within walking distance, and the price was right ($150 night), that we thought it was well worth it, and we'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but make the effort to travel to eat good food!”
Reviews.Author: LizMBirmingham_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely (clean room, large comfy bed, lovely bathroom) and although a little out of the centre there is plenty of good and frequent public transport to get you out and about. Be prepared to use it if you want to eat good Italian food! The hotel "restuarant" is lacking in atmosphere (can't comment on the food) and the local restaurants are not up to par (Rossini restaurant bits of meat found in mushroom Risotto and local cafe staff in Piazza Ungheria very rude and unhelpful. Both overpriced for the quality given). Hotel staff friendly if you make the effort to chat. My top tip for eating is Le Mani in Pasta in Trastevere (via de Genovesi) - well worth the effort, also for pizza, make the (small) effort to go into the centre and go to Gusto (Piazza Augusto Imperatore), but get there early for a table.............wanna make a long night of it? Try some antipasti at Enoteca Antica (via della croce)... lovely wine, lovely range of antipasti, lovely atmosphere.....enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: georgeclooney1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel, stayed in the Borromini for 3 nights and would have liked to have stayed for more. Everyone was very nice and welcoming, especially the reception and breakfast staff. Nothing was a problem to them and their English was very good. The rooms were very clean and had everything you could ask for. Apparently, the hotel has recently been taken over by Boscolo hotels, who operate a number of luxury hotels in Italy and farther afield. It is situated in a quiet residential area, away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but close to trams and bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, can't believe more current reviews!”
Reviews.Author: DaveUS-NC-NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for several nights, the room was very, very spacious, the bathroom was a huge a marble one with a large shower, double sinks, bidet and toilet, spotlessly clean every day. I can't say the personnel were especially friendly but never rude. We met some fellow travelers and spent several pleasant hours in the bar in the hotel. Breakfast was absolutely the best, great cappuccino, bacon, eggs, fruits, pastry and delicious Prosciutto, toast & jelly butter milk, juice, couldn't be better. Yes it's a little out of the way, thats what cabs are for. Local (walking distance) restaurants were fine, many to choose from. I came to this site to make reservations for May of this year. Now I don't know what to think?

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome, disliked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: seastheworld
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the way we were treated the condition of the hotel and the staff. The Shower was not clean... Mold on the walls. Upon checking in, we realized that the Refrigerator did not work . The management replaced it but they removed our items (sodas and waters) that were obviously not part of their "Mini Bar". Before booking this hotel, we looked into numerous hotels .... most offer a complimentary "lite"breakfast with the stay.. bread, cereal, coffee, tea etc. We were "surprised" with a bill on checkout for $68 (48 Euros) for our morning breakfast. (2 days-2 people). There was no menu, sign or notice that mentioned that we were to pay $12 Euros per person for a hard roll and coffee per person per day.. We felt ripped off They advertise that they offer assistance securing transportation to the local airport. However the desk was not helpful. . We had to ask several times if they could assist us in getting a cab back to the airport.. Finally we supplied them with a local number, they seemed to be "put off" by helping us...

Reviews.Title: “No four star for us”
Reviews.Author: travelling894
Reviews.Content: Definitely listen to Trip Advisor reviews on this one. Id have to count this as my most disappointing hotel experience ever. I was really looking forward to seeing Rome and staying in a nice hotel room for my husbands birthday. This hotel does have nice rooms, we saw one, room 419 for example was very nice, like the online photos on their website, but we werent given one like that. I made the mistake of bidding through priceline for a 4 star hotel room in Rome. With that process they assign you a hotel once you agree on a price. We paid $168.00 per night for three nights. We were given room 316. It was a passable 3 star with a few issues, but not a 4 star by any stretch of the imagination. The sheets were clean and the bathroom was nice, but thats all the good I can say about it. We had two beds shoved together even though we requested a king size bed. They did however make it up as one bed our second and third nights. The view was of a brick walled building across the alley. Our chair in the room looked like a used up lawn chair chipped and uncomfortable and the television set was tiny and the sound was permanently set so low you couldnt hear it unless you were 6 inches away from it.. When we requested a nicer room, we were just told we booked a standard room, so were only going to get a standard room. I'd say their standards for 4 star are extremely low. It was a bit out of the center of things but we didnt mind that. I would never stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: roadstump
Reviews.Content: $160,000 USD worth of equipment stolen from my room. While filming a documentary in France and Italy we stayed at the Borromini hotel shortly after Easter holiday. We were only there for 4 nights but on the second night, while I was out to dinner, my room was entered and our high definition camera was stolen from our room. I always leave the Do Not Disturb sign up and a TV going with the sound loud enough to hear from the hallway. The room was NOT broken into. The thief entered WITH A KEY!!!! Absolutely no sign of forced entry. Also stolen was my carry on with my laptop and passport inside. The simply dumped the contents of my suitcase onto the floor, stuck the camera inside and rolled it down the hall. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel yet they do not have a security camera one, not in the halls, not in the lobby. When I informed the night manager about this he suggested I go to bed and we would call the police in the morning. I demanded he call them at that moment. They arrived 10 minutes later, walked around my room, saw that there was no forced entry, and left. No report, no finger prints, nothing. Here is the kicker to all of this. The next day the hotel manager did not offer so much as an apology. When I asked him about this he simply handed me a piece of paper claiming no responsibility. I filed reports the following day with 2 police offices. I am confident that nothing will ever be investigated. They could care less. This hotel SUCKS. If you are forced to stay there do NOT trust anyone or leave anything of any value in your room. Was this an inside job? The only person that knew we were a film crew was the management.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Anakasha
Reviews.Content: I am usually the first person to roll with whatever happens. I have booked hotel rooms where I had no bathroom after i paid for one, or I have even had to share a room with a complete stranger because the hotel was overbooked and there was nowhere else to go. So, when I say I had one of the worst experiences at a hotel that is supposed to be a luxury hotel (and charged me for one) I'm not being over dramatic. After a slight slip while wandering Rome, I got back to the hotel with my ankle the size of a cantaloupe, I asked at the front desk for ice and his response was "the bar is closed" when I tried to explain I didn't want it for drinking but for my injured foot he again said "the bar is closed". Thinking we might have a communication problem I explained what I wanted in Italian, at which point he said "goodnight" and returned to his computer. The next morning while trying to pack my stuff 3 people came barging into my room without knocking, one catching me in all my nakedness, well before checkout time ignoring the do not disturb sign hanging on the door. To be fair, the front desk was kind and to make it up did not charge me for my €22 continental breakfast. Also, they also were able to get me a taxi to the airport very quickly. The hotel on the other hand was clean, and not altogether bad, but for the price I expected much more, and definitely better service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelguru5
Reviews.Content: Very lovely! In a residential neighborhood of Rome which makes the price more affordable but slightly more difficult to get around. I will say there isn't much within walking distance but we went on a tour so that wasn't an issue. Public transportation is close, however. A nice change from the hussle and bussle of the city center. Very clean and comfortable with electric blinds and you could even listen to the TV from a speaker in the bathroom. More electrical outlets than I've ever seen in a European hotel room. Friendly staff and commfortable lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: Anon47
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night before travelling home but was very disappointed with location and overall appearance of hotel. Check in staff were ok but not particularly helpful about public transport issues and you need to know about public transport staying here! Room and hotel corridors appeared dated. There is one large lounge behind reception which seems to house the bar, restaurant and TV lounge all in one, not quite as it looks on the photos! The local area to us was dirty and unkempt. I dont think we saw another tourist outwith the hotel which I suppose would suit some people. 3 or 4 restaurants nearby but that was about all and a fair trek to most of the sites perhaps with the exception of Villa Borghese. We stayed in Hotel Rex for the first part of our trip and it was far superior in terms of character, location and price. Will not be back to the Borromini - the poorest of the Boscolo Hotels by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mcleele1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! Everything was so clean and lovely, new sheets and towels and toiletries everyday. It came with everything we, wanted, a mini bar, telly, electronic blinds, an amazing bathroom! The staff are very friendly and politeful and couldnt be more helpful! This is a hotel we will definatley be going back to. Location wise it is excellent, just a 2 sec walk in to the local piazza which had lots of lovely restaurants and provides easy access to all the main sites in Rome, brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: GCARLING
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel away from the city centre, yet easily accessible by public transport, then this is the hotel for you. A short walk from the hotel takes you to the main bus/tram routes or if not a walk of about 30 minutes will take you to the heart of Rome. The hotel is small and and peaceful, rooms well appointed and clean and food acceptable. Would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jenna77London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Borromini for 3 nights in March and had a fantastic time in Rome. The hotel itself was neither brilliant nor terrible and so overall I think the reviews have been fair. And if you can get a good deal like we did it is certainly value for money. Our room was a nice size, nicely decorated with a lovely bathroom. The bed was definitely the highlight, you can’t help but fall asleep as soon as your head hits the pillow (however this may have something to do with being exhausted from sightseeing) and it’s enormous. The breakfast in the morning was ok although they could have more of a selection and it was also the same each morning, scrambled eggs, parma ham, croissants. Only 2 negative points about the hotel; staff and location. Although the staff responded to our needs efficiently they never seemed friendly or willing to go out of their way for you. With regards to location it is slightly out of the way of central Rome. However once you get your head round the bus system it is just a short 20 minute hop to most of the sites. Rome itself is fantastic and I will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sx7
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, but this was one of the nicesest Hotels I have stayed in. The decor is very modern and probably not to everyones taste but I really liked it. The staff were really nice, friendly and helpful with one of the waiters trying to teach me some Italian. The hotel is a little way out of the centre of Rome and a bit of a trek if you try to get there from the airport using public transport. I booked a car with --- who had a guy waiting for us at the airport and then picking us up from the hotel in air-con'd Mercedes for €35 each way. If you do stay here then I would recommend getting travel passes as you can then take the No 53 bus or the No 19 Tram into the centre, the bus stop is 100 metres away from the hotel (One either end of the road as both roads are one way) If you need a single then these are €1 from any tobacanist or newsagent and are good for 75mins. There is not alot of night life around there, but there are a few cafes and resturants round the corner as well as a bar at the hotel. I payed £178 for 3 nights for 2 people (3rd night free) which included breakfast. I think at this price it was an absolute bargain! I have posted photos, but they are a bit dark and really don't do justice to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good staff”
Reviews.Author: vittoriaDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boscolo Borromini Via Lisbona for 3 days. Although a little bit out of the city center (it is located in the lovely Parioli) we wished to record the high professionalism and friendliness of all the staff .

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: socket
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay in Rome between Xmas and the new Year. My wife and I took our four children aged between 12 and 14. The hotel was fantastic - the kids had a ball - and he staff were soooo friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for them and we would certainly recommend anyone to stay there. The hotel is a little off the beaten track but its only a short bus ride from a stop just outside the hotel to get into the city centre. A cab to the sights costs around €10. The more seculed residential location was a benefit in the evening - the restuarants were full of locals and not tourists, the food was fresh (not microwaved like many city centre tourist traps) and the bill at the end was a pleasant surprise

Reviews.Title: “Service sucks!”
Reviews.Author: MeeowMix
Reviews.Content: We had an average stay at the Borromini hotel. On our arrival for the first night, the front desk agent advised us they had to "walk" us to the Hotel Claridge and they had had a water pipe break on the 6th floor. The only compensation they would give us, was the taxi fare. Fed up from driving around and getting lost with the shuttle, we chose to walk to the other hotel. The next morning, we were told we'd have a room for the following two nights so we had to check out from the Claridge and come back to the Borromini (we did that at the end of the day as we didn't want to miss a minute to visit the city) On our way back, the gentleman working at the front desk had the worst attitude of all. He was the most arrogant person I've met at a hotel. He must have said a total of three words max to us. He took our passports, made copies, gave us our room key and off we were. I had to ask for breakfast hours, room type, wake up call, because he certainly wasn't sharing information. I think I was bothering him... Our room was small and stuffy. The remote control worked half the time, the TV had 5 channels. Since we hadn't taken any desert at the restaurant, we thought to go down and ask if we could have a little something sweet. I was shooed away as at 10pm, only drinks are served. I got in a fight with the bellman with the room temperature because the heat was on, it was 12 degrees outside and to the Romans, that's cold. It was hot in the room. We ended up sleeping with the window open and the heater on. Nice energy conservation eh! The worst thing was that you could hear the neighbours from the vent in the bathroom... and I mean, you could really hear everything! I was terrified! Can't even go to the bathroom without peace! For a four star hotel, it was horrifying! Thank god, we could close a door from the entrance/bathroom to the room itself, so it blocked out "the noise". On the up side, the breakfast was delicious and the morning staff friendly. Unlike the front desk guy, who happened to work every shift when we went by. On the last day, I requested help in securing a shuttle to take us back to the airport. I was told this was impossible and the only option was a private car for 60 euros. Words to the wise, book ahead, check the yellow pages/internet and book it yourself. We did that and it was 40 euros for a private car. All this to say... the hotel may be in a nice neighbourhood, but there is nothing else around. Pay more, stay closer. If you must stay in that area, avoid Borromini, check into Claridge. The rooms have flat screen TVs, the're bigger, cleaner and the bath has two jaccuzi showers. For the same price, the staff is friendly and you can have your breakfast served at your room at no extra cost. Also, they gave us a little "cheat sheet" to get around with the bus and street cars. This saved us great amounts of time as all the main attractions, travel time and bus/tram number were all given. Carry that everywhere you go. Skip Borromini. Service sucks. Room sucks. Sorry. Perhaps the Exedra and Aleph are better? Yeah, dish out the cash :-(

Reviews.Title: “Best night of sleep in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: teresakochel
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks in Europe for our Honeymoon. We started in London and stayed at a Hilton with very small rooms. The Boscolo was a bit out of the way, but it was well worth it. After the loud nights in London and jet lag - I slept like a baby. It was peaceful, clean and we got a kick out of looking at everything and saying, "look at this...and Oh! look at this!" We loved our HUGE room, comfy king bed, heated towel rack, view of the residential area, walk to the park and breakfast was absolutely fabulous. We had about 5 cappuccinos each and all you can eat of anything there. The servers, bartenders and hotel staff were very friendly, even though we spoke minimal Italian. They helped us translate and even taught us new words. I DREAM of going back there. It was one of the best part of our trips. My husband always says, "Remember those nights in Rome?" We highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice hotel but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: meggie49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last year for 3 nights and while it was quite far from the centre of Rome we had a fairly pleasant stay. There is a main road 5 minutes away with trams and buses running to the city centre. If staying here best to find out times of these before you start sightseeing. It is a good half hour walk into Rome centre if you prefer! Rooms were clean although in need of an update, staff courteous enough and spoke some English, but not overly friendly (possibly having problems understanding our attempts at Italian). There is no restaurant in hotel for evening meals but there are some small restaurants within walking distance some better than others. We had booked this at short notice and got a good price but would probably stay nearer central Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is well out of Rome Centre. The last bus from the centre of Rome which stops close to the Hotel (53)leaves at 9.00pm, and it takes well over 35 minutes. The rooms we had were nice but as we were on the 6th floor it the attic rooms the windows were so high up you could not see out of them. For the price of each night I would have expected breakfast to be included but it was 12 or 22 euros extra depending on what you had. A coffee and bun in the local cafe was only 3 euro. Also do not put your hire car in the hotel parking lot as they charge you 30 euro per night. All in all a very expensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting...”
Reviews.Author: claire171
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an odd one. Staff were generally friendly and helpful, except the one receptionist who shouted at me! We were checked into the wrong room originally but they changed it without too much hassle. The rooms were always cleaned nicely and the staff in the breakfast room were particularly friendly. The strangest thing is that the lifts had a permanent smell of brussel sprouts...! However, it really isn't that close to the main tourist sites. The local bus service is relatively frequent (buy a ticket before you board or you'll end up skipping the fare!) and if you don't mind walking you can be in a fairly central location in 40 minutes or so. I probably wouldn't go back to that hotel because I'm not a 4star kind of girl, but it's a fairly nice place. And - wow - what an amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: Gerry0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly 'average' and it is quite a long way out of Central Rome. The room that we booked was clean and pleasant with the added bonus of a private terrace. As you can see from the photo, this is not a Renaissance building as described on some site travel sites. To get into Rome's centre, you have a choice of trams (one goes to the South of the City Centre past the Colosseum and the other takes you to the north of the centre nearer to the Vatican). The tram is a very pleasant and more authentic way of travelling around and it is cheap. The other alternative is travelling in and out by taxi and that wasnt as expensive as we thought if you use it infrequently or late at night (about 10 euros one way). If you are looking for a hotel way out of the centre in a quiet suburb, this will be OK. Decor average, service average but quiet nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly people, esp. in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, rooms and breakfast food very good ... we spent an extended weekend and we enjoyed also a beautiful weather (25 Celsius degress end of October). The package price was also excellent. The only thing to be mentioned is the distance from the city center ... it takes about 30 min. on rush hours (for 15 Euro fee) and only 10 min. in the evenings ... with very speedy taxi drivers. Very good impression on waiter' s kindness and hospitality, esp. Alvaro from breakfast. Mille grazie Alvaro!

Reviews.Title: “never ever stay here!|”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: unbelievably bad experience! American Express booked me into this so called luxury hotel...that turns out to be 40 min by taxi from the train station, breakfast costs an extra 12€.. unflexible staff, no restaurants, tacky decor...and I could go on...all this for 188€ a night! Never ever will I recommend this place or stay here again...;(
